before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"cdbt0","text":"Read the 'Safety Warnings' section for biosafety precautions necessary for handling raw wastewater samples. Prepare the fume hood for wastewater handling, gather materials and reagents (centrifuge tubes, serological pipettes, pipette tips, micropipettes, a marker, strips of parafilm, sterile-filtered 10% Tween 20, PBS). Label centrifuge tubes (five tubes for each influent sample, and two for a negative control sample). Ensure proper PPE.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"c1gva","text":"This protocol details our workflow for performing concentration and total nucleic acid extraction from wastewater influent for the purposes of untargeted RNA and DNA sequencing of viruses present in wastewater. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3k67f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d83vc","text":"Protocol overview: 200 mL of raw influent wastewater is concentrated to a final volume of 400 uL using the InnovaPrep Concentrating Pipette Select. Prior to concentration, the wastewater sample is treated with Tween 20 and sonicated to dissociate viral particles from solids in the wastewater matrix. The sample is then centrifuged to pellet larger solids. The pellet is discarded, and the supernatant is filtered with a 0.45 um PES 75 mm filtration unit to remove remaining suspended solids and bacteria. This filtrate is then concentrated with the Concentrating Pipette, using Ultra CPT tips and recommended device settings for the InnovaPrep modified wastewater processing protocol. Nucleic acids are extracted from the concentrated product using the Zymo quick-DNA/RNA Viral kit using the manufacturer protocol with a few modifications that we have found to be helpful.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Part 1: Influent Handling, Dissociation, Centrifugation, Filtration
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a7bre","text":"Prepare aliquots of influent. Invert the bottle of influent several times to re-suspend contents, then carefully open it. Using a fresh 50 mL serological pipette, aspirate and dispense   of influent into a 50 mL centrifuge tube. Repeat until   of influent has been dispensed across 5 centrifuge tubes. Repeat for desired number of sample replicates. For a negative control, add   of 1X PBS to two centrifuge tubes each using a fresh 50 mL serological pipette, for a total volume of  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":185,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":242,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":378,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":482,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"csikq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b2uqj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"40","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"40","error":false,"guid":"D0882753B3D411EEAA800A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"80","error":false,"guid":"5F713E54BC8F11EE96EF0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"4":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"agn9s","text":"The 200 mL sample is separated into five 50 mL tubes due to supply and equipment limitations.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2eanf","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8i8fh","text":"EHS also recommended limiting sample volume to 40 mL in each tube to reduce the risk of leaks.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Part 1: Influent Handling, Dissociation, Centrifugation, Filtration
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5oaup","text":"Transfer all centrifuge tubes from the fume hood to a centrifuge equipped with the appropriate rotor and/or adapters (ex: Beckman Coulter Avanti J series with JA-14.50 rotor) . Centrifuge the samples at  . After centrifugation is complete, wait   (as recommended by EHS) to allow aerosols to settle before opening the centrifuge. Remove samples from the centrifuge and return them to the fume hood.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":203,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":245,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e6mv0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bro5r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3lc3u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"10000","duration":300,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

steps.section: Part 1: Influent Handling, Dissociation, Centrifugation, Filtration
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9ddrl","text":"Decant the supernatant from all five influent tubes directly into a 0.45 um vacuum filtration top attached to the influent sample collection bottle, taking care not to dislodge the pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fdq0n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5loqq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8m528","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8jr8p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"align":"","guid":"91AF91ECCC2011EE973C0A58A9FEAC02","height":301.92363636363643,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"9vgv8\",\"text\":\"Centrifuge tubes contain a total of 200 mL influent sample (40 mL x 5 tubes). steps.section: Part 1: Influent Handling, Dissociation, Centrifugation, Filtration
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2819e","text":"For the negative control centrifuge tubes, decant both directly into a 0.45 um vacuum filtration top. There should not be a pellet. Perform vacuum filtration as was done for the influent, cap the pyrex bottle, and set aside.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Part 2: Concentration via InnovaPrep Concentrating Pipette Select
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fkod6","text":"Remove the maintenance tip and place a fresh Ultra CPT into the tip port. Lower the tip into the sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"efjeh","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"buu22","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7dgcu","text":"Ensure that the Tip is as close to the bottom of the sample bottle as possible. A bottle of PBS can be used as the weighted object.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Part 2: Concentration via InnovaPrep Concentrating Pipette Select
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bsg93","text":"Press \"Start Run\", allow the Concentrating Pipette to aspirate the waste, and wait until it beeps to signal the end of the run.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bqj1v","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"449j5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"95kbq","text":"A timer will run on the display during the concentration. The Concentrating Pipette will stop aspirating and begin to beep when the Tip detects air instead of liquid sample. Concentration  should take roughly 17 min, but can vary based on the consistency of the sample.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Part 2: Concentration via InnovaPrep Concentrating Pipette Select
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"70fj4","text":"While holding a 5 mL centrifuge tube under the Tip, press \"Elute\" and catch the foam that is dispensed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"7bqv9","text":"Biosafety precautions: All raw wastewater samples will be received and stored with primary and secondary containment. The primary container (the bottle or falcon tube) should remain in the secondary container (a Ziploc bag containing paper towels to absorb spills) until processed. All raw samples must be handled within a dedicated fume hood or biosafety cabinet. All laboratory personnel handling these samples must use safety glasses, gloves, and lab coats. Samples will be transported between processing stations within a secondary container that has been cleaned with PreEmpt. All surfaces (outside of the fume hood/sash, centrifuge lid and rotor, etc.) will also be wiped down with PreEmpt. All autoclave-able bottles that are in contact with wastewater samples will be cleaned by filling with 10% bleach for at least 20 minutes before disposal.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
